function.description: Returns the selection atom for the current source window.
function.return: the selection atom.

function.name: gdk_init_check
function.description:
Initialize the library for use.
Arguments: "argc" is the number of arguments. "argv" is an array of strings.
Results: "argc" and "argv" are modified to reflect any arguments which were not handled. (Such arguments should either be handled by the application or dismissed). If initialization fails, returns FALSE, otherwise TRUE.
Side effects: The library is initialized.
--------------------------------------------------------------

function.name: gdk_keymap_lookup_key
function.description: Looks up the keyval mapped to a keycode/group/level triplet. If no keyval is bound to @key, returns 0. For normal user input, you want to use gdk_keymap_translate_keyboard_state() instead of this function, since the effective group/level may not be the same as the current keyboard state.

parameter.name: keymap
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkKeymap or %NULL to use the default keymap

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkKeymapKey with keycode, group, and level initialized

function.return: a keyval, or 0 if none was mapped to the given @key

function.name: gdk_drawable_get_visual
function.description: Gets the #GdkVisual describing the pixel format of @drawable.
function.return: a #GdkVisual

function.name: gdk_setting_get
function.description: Obtains a desktop-wide setting, such as the double-click time, for the default screen. See gdk_screen_get_setting().

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the value of the setting.

function.return: %TRUE if the setting existed and a value was stored in @value, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gdk_cursor_new_from_name
function.description:
Creates a new cursor by looking up @name in the current cursor theme.
Since: 2.8

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: the #GdkDisplay for which the cursor will be created

function.return: a new #GdkCursor, or %NULL if there is no cursor with the given name

function.name: gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf
function.description:
Sets the given pixbuf as the source pattern for the Cairo context. The pattern has an extend mode of %CAIRO_EXTEND_NONE and is aligned so that the origin of @pixbuf is @pixbuf_x, @pixbuf_y
Since: 2.8

parameter.name: pixbuf_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of location to place upper left corner of @pixbuf

parameter.name: pixbuf_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of location to place upper left corner of @pixbuf

function.name: gdk_window_scroll
function.description:
Scroll the contents of @window, both pixels and children, by the given amount. @window itself does not move. Portions of the window that the scroll operation brings in from offscreen areas are invalidated. The invalidated region may be bigger than what would strictly be necessary.
For X11, a minimum area will be invalidated if the window has no subwindows, or if the edges of the window's parent do not extend beyond the edges of the window. In other cases, a multi-step process is used to scroll the window which may produce temporary visual artifacts and unnecessary invalidations.

parameter.name: dx
parameter.parameter_description: Amount to scroll in the X direction

parameter.name: dy
parameter.parameter_description: Amount to scroll in the Y direction

function.name: gdkx_visual_get
function.description: Returns a #GdkVisual corresponding to a X visual.
function.return: the #GdkVisual.

function.name: gdk_display_pointer_ungrab
function.description:
Release any pointer grab.
Since: 2.2

function.name: gdk_gc_set_fill
function.description:
Set the fill mode for a graphics context.
Deprecated: 2.22: You can achieve tiling in Cairo by using cairo_pattern_set_extend() on the source. For stippling, see the deprecation comments on gdk_gc_set_stipple().

function.name: gdk_screen_get_window_stack
function.description:
Returns a #GList of #GdkWindow<!-- -->s representing the current window stack.
On X11, this is done by inspecting the _NET_CLIENT_LIST_STACKING property on the root window, as described in the <ulink url="http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/wm-spec">Extended Window Manager Hints</ulink>. If the window manager does not support the _NET_CLIENT_LIST_STACKING hint, this function returns %NULL.
On other platforms, this function may return %NULL, depending on whether it is implementable on that platform.
The returned list is newly allocated and owns references to the windows it contains, so it should be freed using g_list_free() and its windows unrefed using g_object_unref() when no longer needed.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a list of #GdkWindow<!-- -->s for the current window stack, or %NULL.

function.name: gdk_screen_get_rgba_visual
function.description:
Gets a visual to use for creating windows or pixmaps with an alpha channel. See the docs for gdk_screen_get_rgba_colormap() for caveats.
Since: 2.8
function.return: a visual to use for windows with an alpha channel or %NULL if the capability is not available.

function.name: gdk_text_extents_wc
function.description: Gets the metrics of a string of wide characters.

parameter.name: text_length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the text in character.

parameter.name: lbearing
parameter.parameter_description: the left bearing of the string.

parameter.name: rbearing
parameter.parameter_description: the right bearing of the string.

function.name: gdk_pango_renderer_set_drawable
function.description:
Sets the drawable the renderer draws to.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gdk_window_set_role
function.description:
When using GTK+, typically you should use gtk_window_set_role() instead of this low-level function.
The window manager and session manager use a window's role to distinguish it from other kinds of window in the same application. When an application is restarted after being saved in a previous session, all windows with the same title and role are treated as interchangeable. So if you have two windows with the same title that should be distinguished for session management purposes, you should set the role on those windows. It doesn't matter what string you use for the role, as long as you have a different role for each non-interchangeable kind of window.

function.name: gdk_window_get_effective_toplevel
function.description:
Gets the toplevel window that's an ancestor of @window.
Works like gdk_window_get_toplevel(), but treats an offscreen window's embedder as its parent, using gdk_window_get_effective_parent().
See also: gdk_offscreen_window_get_embedder()
Since: 2.22
function.return: the effective toplevel window containing @window

function.name: gdk_get_show_events
function.description: Gets whether event debugging output is enabled.
function.return: %TRUE if event debugging output is enabled.

function.name: gdk_window_merge_child_shapes
function.description:
Merges the shape masks for any child windows into the shape mask for @window. i.e. the union of all masks for @window and its children will become the new mask for @window. See gdk_window_shape_combine_mask().
This function is distinct from gdk_window_set_child_shapes() because it includes @window's shape mask in the set of shapes to be merged.

function.name: gdk_window_at_pointer
function.description:
Obtains the window underneath the mouse pointer, returning the location of that window in @win_x, @win_y. Returns %NULL if the window under the mouse pointer is not known to GDK (if the window belongs to another application and a #GdkWindow hasn't been created for it with gdk_window_foreign_new())
NOTE: For multihead-aware widgets or applications use gdk_display_get_window_at_pointer() instead.

parameter.name: win_x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for origin of the window under the pointer

parameter.name: win_y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for origin of the window under the pointer

function.return: window under the mouse pointer

function.name: gdk_window_get_type_hint
function.description:
This function returns the type hint set for a window.
Since: 2.10
function.return: The type hint set for @window

function.name: gdk_colormap_new
function.description: Creates a new colormap for the given visual.

parameter.name: allocate
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, the newly created colormap will be a private colormap, and all colors in it will be allocated for the applications use.

function.return: the new #GdkColormap.

function.name: gdk_screen_get_resolution
function.description:
Gets the resolution for font handling on the screen; see gdk_screen_set_resolution() for full details.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the current resolution, or -1 if no resolution has been set.

function.name: gdk_draw_lines
function.description:
Draws a series of lines connecting the given points. The way in which joins between lines are draw is determined by the #GdkCapStyle value in the #GdkGC. This can be set with gdk_gc_set_line_attributes().
Deprecated: 2.22: Use cairo_line_to() and cairo_stroke() instead. See the documentation of gdk_draw_line() for notes on line drawing with Cairo.

parameter.name: points
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GdkPoint structures specifying the endpoints of the

function.name: gdk_pango_renderer_set_stipple
function.description:
Sets the stipple for one render part (foreground, background, underline, etc.) Note that this is overwritten when iterating through the individual styled runs of a #PangoLayout or #PangoLayoutLine. This function is thus only useful when you call low level functions like pango_renderer_draw_glyphs() directly, or in the 'prepare_run' virtual function of a subclass of #GdkPangoRenderer.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: part
parameter.parameter_description: the part to render with the stipple

function.name: gdk_x11_display_get_xdisplay
function.description:
Returns the X display of a #GdkDisplay.
Since: 2.2
function.return: an X display.

function.name: gdk_color_free
function.description: Frees a color structure created with gdk_color_copy().

function.name: gdk_window_end_paint
function.description: Indicates that the backing store created by the most recent call to gdk_window_begin_paint_region() should be copied onscreen and deleted, leaving the next-most-recent backing store or no backing store at all as the active paint region. See gdk_window_begin_paint_region() for full details. It is an error to call this function without a matching gdk_window_begin_paint_region() first.

function.name: gdk_gc_set_dashes
function.description:
Sets the way dashed-lines are drawn. Lines will be drawn with alternating on and off segments of the lengths specified in @dash_list. The manner in which the on and off segments are drawn is determined by the @line_style value of the GC. (This can be changed with gdk_gc_set_line_attributes().)
The @dash_offset defines the phase of the pattern, specifying how many pixels into the dash-list the pattern should actually begin.
Deprecated: 2.22: Use cairo_set_dash() to set the dash in Cairo.

parameter.name: dash_offset
parameter.parameter_description: the phase of the dash pattern.

function.name: gdk_region_new
function.description: Creates a new empty #GdkRegion.
function.return: a new empty #GdkRegion

function.name: gdk_window_get_toplevels
function.description:
Obtains a list of all toplevel windows known to GDK on the default screen (see gdk_screen_get_toplevel_windows()). A toplevel window is a child of the root window (see gdk_get_default_root_window()).
The returned list should be freed with g_list_free(), but its elements need not be freed.
Deprecated: 2.16: Use gdk_screen_get_toplevel_windows() instead.
function.return: list of toplevel windows, free with g_list_free()

function.name: gdk_threads_add_timeout_seconds_full
function.description:
A variant of gdk_threads_add_timout_full() with second-granularity. See g_timeout_add_seconds_full() for a discussion of why it is a good idea to use this function if you don't need finer granularity.
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: priority
parameter.parameter_description: the priority of the timeout source. Typically this will be in the range between #G_PRIORITY_DEFAULT_IDLE and #G_PRIORITY_HIGH_IDLE.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.parameter_description: the time between calls to the function, in seconds

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the timeout is removed, or %NULL

function.return: the ID (greater than 0) of the event source.

function.name: gdk_char_width_wc
function.description: Determines the width of a given wide character. (Encoded in the wide-character encoding of the current locale).
function.return: the width of the character in pixels.

function.name: gdk_drag_find_window_for_screen
function.description:
Finds the destination window and DND protocol to use at the given pointer position.
This function is called by the drag source to obtain the @dest_window and @protocol parameters for gdk_drag_motion().
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: drag_window
parameter.parameter_description: a window which may be at the pointer position, but should be ignored, since it is put up by the drag source as an icon.

parameter.name: screen
parameter.parameter_description: the screen where the destination window is sought.

parameter.name: x_root
parameter.parameter_description: the x position of the pointer in root coordinates.

parameter.name: y_root
parameter.parameter_description: the y position of the pointer in root coordinates.

parameter.name: dest_window
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the destination window in.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the DND protocol in.

function.name: gdk_color_parse
function.description: Parses a textual specification of a color and fill in the <structfield>red</structfield>, <structfield>green</structfield>, and <structfield>blue</structfield> fields of a #GdkColor structure. The color is <emphasis>not</emphasis> allocated, you must call gdk_colormap_alloc_color() yourself. The string can either one of a large set of standard names. (Taken from the X11 <filename>rgb.txt</filename> file), or it can be a hex value in the form '#rgb' '#rrggbb' '#rrrgggbbb' or '#rrrrggggbbbb' where 'r', 'g' and 'b' are hex digits of the red, green, and blue components of the color, respectively. (White in the four forms is '#fff' '#ffffff' '#fffffffff' and '#ffffffffffff')
function.return: %TRUE if the parsing succeeded.

function.name: gdk_window_get_background_pattern
function.description:
Gets the pattern used to clear the background on @window. If @window does not have its own background and reuses the parent's, %NULL is returned and you'll have to query it yourself.
Since: 2.22
function.return: The pattern to use for the background or %NULL to use the parent's background.

function.name: gdk_visual_get_best_with_both
function.description: Combines gdk_visual_get_best_with_depth() and gdk_visual_get_best_with_type().
function.return: best visual with both @depth and @visual_type, or %NULL if none

function.name: gdk_x11_get_default_xdisplay
function.description: Gets the default GTK+ display.
function.return: the Xlib <type>Display*</type> for the display specified in the <option>--display</option> command line option or the <envar>DISPLAY</envar> environment variable.

function.name: gdk_screen_get_width
function.description:
Gets the width of @screen in pixels
Since: 2.2
function.return: the width of @screen in pixels.

function.name: gdk_device_free_history
function.description: Frees an array of #GdkTimeCoord that was returned by gdk_device_get_history().

function.name: gdk_gc_set_values
function.description:
Sets attributes of a graphics context in bulk. For each flag set in @values_mask, the corresponding field will be read from @values and set as the new value for @gc. If you're only setting a few values on @gc, calling individual "setter" functions is likely more convenient.
Deprecated: 2.22: Use Cairo for rendering.

parameter.name: values_mask
parameter.parameter_description: mask indicating which struct fields are to be used

function.name: gdk_x11_lookup_xdisplay
function.description:
Find the #GdkDisplay corresponding to @display, if any exists.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: xdisplay
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to an X Display

function.return: the #GdkDisplay, if found, otherwise %NULL.

function.name: gdk_window_set_child_shapes
function.description: Sets the shape mask of @window to the union of shape masks for all children of @window, ignoring the shape mask of @window itself. Contrast with gdk_window_merge_child_shapes() which includes the shape mask of @window in the masks to be merged.

function.name: gdk_region_get_clipbox
function.description: Obtains the smallest rectangle which includes the entire #GdkRegion.

function.name: gdk_window_get_group
function.description:
Returns the group leader window for @window. See gdk_window_set_group().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the group leader window for @window

function.name: gdk_pango_renderer_get_default
function.description:
Gets the default #PangoRenderer for a screen. This default renderer is shared by all users of the display, so properties such as the color or transformation matrix set for the renderer may be overwritten by functions such as gdk_draw_layout().
Before using the renderer, you need to call gdk_pango_renderer_set_drawable() and gdk_pango_renderer_set_gc() to set the drawable and graphics context to use for drawing.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the default #PangoRenderer for @screen. The renderer is owned by GTK+ and will be kept around until the screen is closed.

function.name: gdk_region_copy
function.description: Copies @region, creating an identical new region.
function.return: a new region identical to @region

function.name: gdk_window_show
function.description:
Like gdk_window_show_unraised(), but also raises the window to the top of the window stack (moves the window to the front of the Z-order).
This function maps a window so it's visible onscreen. Its opposite is gdk_window_hide().
When implementing a #GtkWidget, you should call this function on the widget's #GdkWindow as part of the "map" method.

function.name: gdk_window_constrain_size
function.description: Constrains a desired width and height according to a set of geometry hints (such as minimum and maximum size).

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: a mask indicating what portions of @geometry are set

function.name: gdk_color_copy
function.description: Makes a copy of a color structure. The result must be freed using gdk_color_free().
function.return: a copy of @color.

function.name: gdk_window_thaw_updates
function.description: Thaws a window frozen with gdk_window_freeze_updates().

function.name: gdk_x11_get_default_root_xwindow
function.description: Gets the root window of the default screen (see gdk_x11_get_default_screen()).
function.return: an Xlib <type>Window</type>.

function.name: gdk_text_width_wc
function.description: Determines the width of a given wide-character string.

parameter.name: text_length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the text in characters.

function.return: the width of the string in pixels.

function.name: gdk_image_get_bytes_per_line
function.description:
Determines the number of bytes per line of the image.
Since: 2.22
Deprecated: 2.22: #GdkImage should not be used anymore.
function.return: the bytes per line

function.name: gdk_x11_display_broadcast_startup_message
function.description:
Sends a startup notification message of type @message_type to @display.
This is a convenience function for use by code that implements the freedesktop startup notification specification. Applications should not normally need to call it directly. See the <ulink url="http://standards.freedesktop.org/startup-notification-spec/startup-notification-latest.txt">Startup Notification Protocol specification</ulink> for definitions of the message types and keys that can be used.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: a list of key/value pairs (as strings), terminated by a %NULL key. (A %NULL value for a key will cause that key to be skipped in the output.)
